$!You may need to tell DVLA if you have Addison's disease.$!

%You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.%

##Car or motorcycle licence##

You don't need to tell DVLA if you have Addison's disease.

##Bus, coach or lorry licence##

You must tell DVLA if you have Addison's disease. Fill in form G1V and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download ‘G1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 318KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065273.pdf "Download ‘G1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 318KB)"){:rel="external"}
$D

*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency
overview: You must tell DVLA if you have Addison's disease and drive a bus, coach or lorry - download the correct form to let them know
title: Addison's disease and driving
